meanings.definition: The act of betraying someone's trust or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The backstabbings in the office caused a lot of tension among coworkers.
meanings.sent2: She felt hurt by the backstabbings of her so-called friends.
meanings.sent3: The backstabbings in the school play were just pretend, but they looked so real!
meanings.sent4: The backstabbings in politics can be more damaging than any physical attack.
meanings.sent5: The backstabbings in the novel made the plot even more intriguing.

meanings.definition: A betrayal or act of treachery, especially when done secretly or deceitfully.
meanings.sent1: The backstabbings among the rival gangs led to a dangerous feud.
meanings.sent2: He never expected such backstabbings from his own family.
meanings.sent3: The backstabbings in the game of chess caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The backstabbings in the spy movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The backstabbings in the fairy tale added a dark twist to the story.
